content.question: A home uses fuel oil at the rate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>r</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>t</mi> <mrow> <mn>60</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@450C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per day, where t is the number of days from the beginning of the heating season. To the nearest gallon, what is the total amount of fuel oil used from t = 0 to t = 60 days?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
